question: 瑛斗
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>crystal</kanji> <kanji>ladle</kanji> is the Japanese given name <vocabulary>Eito</vocabulary>. If you know the singer-songwriter Eito, imagine him holding a crystal ladle. If not, any Eito will do! Other public figures with the name include pro baseball player Tanaka Eito (<ja>田中 瑛斗</ja>) and Takarazuka actor Namiki Eito (<ja>波輝 瑛斗</ja>).
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This name uses the on'yomi for both kanji, and you learned both these readings with the kanji. Get yourself a crystal ladle to celebrate!

Note: This name can also sometimes be read <ja>あきと</ja>, as is the case for pro baseball player Takabe Akito (<ja>髙部 瑛斗</ja>).
